document.masterDocTitle: Systematics of the Protohermes costalis species-group (Megaloptera: Corydalidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematics of the Protohermes costalis species-group (Megaloptera: Corydalidae)

heading.emphasis:
Protohermes gutianensis Yan
g & Ya n g

subSubSection.paragraph:
Protohermes gutianensis
Yang & Yang, 1995
b. Insects and macrofungi of Gutianshan, Zhejiang, p. 129 . Type locality: Zhejiang (Kaihua).

Diagnosis . Head with black markings from anterior edge of compound eyes through to occiput and a narrow blackish vittae medially on vertex; pronotum with one pair of blackish vittae on lateral margins; wings pale smoky brown with several indistinct yellowish spots except for apical regions without spots; male ninth sternum with suboblong posterior incision.
Body length 28–31 mm (male) and 40–45 mm (female); forewing length 38–48 mm (male) and 48–52 mm (female), hindwing length 35–41 mm (male) and 43–47 mm (female).

Material examined. Holotype ɗ, CHINA : Zhejiang, Gutianshan,

Distribution . China (Fujian, Gansu, Guangdong, Guangxi, Guizhou, Henan, Jiangxi, Sichuan, Zhejiang).

Remarks .
Protohermes gutianensis
appears to be closely related to
P. acutatus
by the absence of the apical round markings of both wings, but it can be easily separated from
P. acutatus
by having the head with a pair of slender blackish vittae and the male ninth sternum with deep suboblong apical incision, both of which are unique in the P. c o s t a l i s group.
